2.text: “Does a wise man answer with empty counsel or fill his belly with the hot east wind?

3.text: Should he argue with useless words or speeches that serve no purpose?

4.text: But you even undermine the fear of God and hinder meditation before Him.

5.text: For your iniquity instructs your mouth, and you choose the language of the crafty.

6.text: Your own mouth, not mine, condemns you; your own lips testify against you.

7.text: Were you the first man ever born? Were you brought forth before the hills?

8.text: Do you listen in on the council of God or limit wisdom to yourself?

9.text: What do you know that we do not? What do you understand that is not clear to us?

10.text: Both the gray-haired and the aged are on our side—men much older than your father.

11.text: Are the consolations of God not enough for you, even words spoken gently to you?

12.text: Why has your heart carried you away, and why do your eyes flash,

13.text: so that you turn your spirit against God and pour such words from your mouth?

14.text: What is man, that he should be pure, or one born of woman, that he should be righteous?

15.text: If God puts no trust in His holy ones, if even the heavens are not pure in His eyes,

16.text: how much less man, who is vile and corrupt, who drinks injustice like water?

17.text: Listen to me and I will inform you. I will describe what I have seen,

18.text: what was declared by wise men and was not concealed from their fathers,

19.text: to whom alone the land was given when no foreigner passed among them.

20.text: A wicked man writhes in pain all his days; only a few years are reserved for the ruthless.

21.text: Sounds of terror fill his ears; in his prosperity the destroyer attacks him.

22.text: He despairs of his return from darkness; he is marked for the sword.

23.text: He wanders about as food for vultures; he knows the day of darkness is at hand.

24.text: Distress and anguish terrify him, overwhelming him like a king poised to attack.

25.text: For he has stretched out his hand against God and has vaunted himself against the Almighty,

26.text: rushing headlong at Him with a thick, studded shield.

27.text: Though his face is covered with fat and his waistline bulges with flesh,

28.text: he will dwell in ruined cities, in abandoned houses destined to become rubble.

29.text: He will no longer be rich; his wealth will not endure. His possessions will not overspread the land.

30.text: He will not escape from the darkness; the flame will wither his shoots, and the breath of God’s mouth will carry him away.

31.text: Let him not deceive himself with trust in emptiness, for emptiness will be his reward.

32.text: It will be paid in full before his time, and his branch will not flourish.

33.text: He will be like a vine stripped of its unripe grapes, like an olive tree that sheds its blossoms.

34.text: For the company of the godless will be barren, and fire will consume the tents of bribery.

35.text: They conceive trouble and give birth to evil; their womb is pregnant with deceit.”
